thread.title: Mets Prematurely Predict Trip to World Series
thread.title_full: Mets Prematurely Predict Trip to World Series

title: Mets Prematurely Predict Trip to World Series
text: Privacy Policy | More Newsletters Getty Images Daniel Murphy #28 and Curtis Granderson #3 of the New York Mets celebrate after defeating the Chicago Cubs in Game 3 of the 2015 MLB National League Championship Series at Wrigley Field on Oct. 20, 2015, in Chicago, Illinois. The Mets defeated the Cubs with a score of 5 to 2. (Photo by Elsa/Getty Images) In a move that could possibly reverse the Cubs' curse, the New York Mets prematurely predicted their own trip to the World Series one game shy of clinching the NLCS. On Wednesday afternoon, just hours before the Cubs take on the Mets in a do-or-die Game 4, the Mets' website briefly advertised World Series Mets gear. According to ESPN , the website declared the Mets "National League Champions" and advertised an orange and blue t-shirt emblazoned with "The Pennant Will Rise." Cubs Set Game 3 Lineup vs. Mets Jay Horwitz, vice president of media relations for the Mets, told ESPN the advertisement was a "glitch," and it soon disappeared from the site. The Mets are leading the Cubs 3-0 in the NLCS, but they still need one more win to get to the World Series. And though the odds may seem long, Cubs president Theo Epstein, who was general manager of the Boston Red Sox in 2004, seemed optimistic, saying that if anyone could overcome the odds, it would be the Cubs .
